intro: Stirlingia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf stirlingia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Stirlingia latifolia is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
